If you have 0-4/5/6/7 occupations left in hand, you immediately get 1 stone/reed/clay/wood.
You immediately get a number of stone equal to the number of people you have.
You immediately get 2 food and 1 additional food for each major improvement you have from the bottom row of the supply board.
You can immediately choose to either get 1 reed or exchange 1 reed for 1 cattle.
This card can hold 1 animal for each pasture you have, even different types. After the breeding phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each unused spot on this card.
This card can hold up to 3 animals of the same type. (It is not considered a pasture).
Place a stone room on round space 12. If you live in a stone house at the start of the round, you can build the stone room at no cost. Otherwise, discard the stone room.
Immediately after each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can use the taken wood (and only that) to build exactly 1 pasture. If you do, one of the fences is free.
chenDesc: 这张卡就是我觉得他是一张非常陷阱的卡。因为它看起来是赚三根木头和一动，但是第一他对栅栏的大小有要求。就是说你本身你在拿木头的时候，你栅栏只能往外围，而不能在中间插零碎的栅栏。所以拿木头的时候势必会有多余的木头，不会拿的那么整齐。第二的话，如果你是职业打的比较多的卡组的话，后期一定是会有从卡牌里获得了木头的，不会说所有木头都是从场上去获得。你在这种情况下，后期的木头其实没有第二个特别优秀的转化途径。一般来讲我觉得用这张卡大部分情况下，他可能只发动一次到两次，后期再去把剩下的木头围成栅栏结束这一把。它的真实的收益就是说提供一个比较早的饲养空间，然后木头上不赚不亏。他就可以相当于是一张免费的饲养空间卡，但是就是会亏一点前期节奏。后期使用第二次的时候多给一个木头，就是他全部的作用。一张零成本的饲养空间卡，这就是我对他的定义。

effect: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can pay 2 wood to plow 1 field. Place the paid wood on the accumulation space (for the next visitor).
Add 1 to the current round for each building resource in your supply and place 1 field on the corresponding round space. A the start of the round, you can plow the field.
chenDesc: 这张卡垃圾啊，没用，把所有条件都去了才能用

effect: Add 7, 8, and 9 to the current round and place 1 field on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you can plow the field.
Place 4 food on this card. Each time you obtain at least 1 grain, you also get 1 food from this card. Once it is empty, you get a "Family Growth Even without Room" action.
chenDesc: 应该算是一个A级卡。从理论上来讲，它是应该符合一张S级卡的效果的。但是从实际上来讲，就是因为理论上来讲，它你其实在第九回合能够生出来的话，它都有一个S卡的价值。但是实际上就是你生他的过程是亏动的。三木和四麦子算底平的话，你再去生娃的过程中，你这个四个麦子，平均来讲在没有配合的情况下，或者说你在70%以上的情况下，这张卡都是要亏2动以上的。就是如果说你在你希望用他生第一个娃，这张卡通常会亏掉三动左右。如果你用他生第二个娃的话，通常是从卡里面获得两个麦子，在手中拿两个麦子，这时候你再第九季把它生出来，它相当于亏七动，但是你手中拿了两个麦子亏了一动，它的总体收益就是5~6个。所以它就是一个强A卡。就是相比于和这个七分的，这个就是和九回合打出来能够获得七分的礼拜堂来讲，这两张卡效果其实大差不差。然后也会有一些非常优质的配合，比如礼拜堂可以配合声卡强大的声卡，然后这张卡是可以配合一些就是能够快速给麦子的卡，还有一些农业上的卡，也各有一些配合。没有配合的情况下，这两张卡收益大差不差。

effect: You immediately get 2 food. You must immediately place a person from your supply. If you do, in the next returning home phase, you must remove that person from play.
chenDesc:
效果：给一动和食物
强度：就是一张很符合说的就是通用，然后给一动这个特征。两个饭多给了一点收益，但是他还有一个副作用。和这两口饭基本底线就是约等于送一动。不过考虑到有时候他这个送的这一动是一个非常大的一动，如果你在生娃阶段打出来的话，它其实是超过一动的。但是另一个角度讲，他在你在这个速一动的卡，还是前面那句话，速一动的卡大部分情况下，你是希望他是能够在任何在你没有次发可打的情况下去打他。所以就是一个普通的用，没有那么强。算是送一动里最强的那一档，但是他从强度来讲还是达不到送一动的水平。再加上他的这个副作用也不是每个卡组都能承受，所以大概就在这个位置。

effect: Place the action space card for round 14 face up in front of you. Only you can use it until it is placed on the game board.
chenDesc: 我觉得效果很一般。就是你在什么时候会需要一次翻修。那就是在大部分情况下，你如果就是在最后一回合前凑够了木头，那通常直接去翻修了就好了。最后一回合你再拿一点资源，然后翻修去打一张卡，这样的话行动才用的比较充分。你在最后一回合前翻修的话，那你最后一回合都可以选，这个行动就比较尴尬了。你在最后一回合就没有一个稳定能够末端属于你的行动去拿的。通常情况下，你要是房子比较多的话，你最后最后一回合你有好几个人，你可以让他们去拿点资源再打个发展卡或者之类什么的。但是最终章你在前一回合这个操作的话，他可能只能就是适用于那种对于翻修特别紧张，比如秘书这种卡组是可以用最终章保一下翻修的。通常卡组的话，我觉得最终章这张卡约等于一张没条件的白板，就是没条件也没收益。

effect: Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you can take a "Build Fences" action instead of one of the two actions provide by the action space.
In the work phase, after each turn in which you build at least 1 room, stable, or fence, you can build the "Joinery", "pottery", or Basketmaker's Workshop" major improvement.
chenDesc: 很简明的配件卡。就是如果你想打多个工坊，而且是打打出速度有要求的话，就是你想在后期第三季到第四季去打多个工坊，工具箱可以为你提供两动的收益。

effect: Each time after you use the "Forest" accumulation space, you can return 2 wood to that space to play 1 occupation without paying an occupation costs.
Each time you use a "Lesson" action space and a cooking improvement on the same turn, you get 1 bonus point.
chenDesc: 烹饪课程净收益其实还是蛮高的，他的净收益是可以达到3动的水平。但是这张卡呢，就是由于他的条件实在是太苛刻了。他首先你需要在很早的时候去打出来它，而且划掉宝贵的两饭。从这个角度的话，如果你在早期花掉两饭去打出来它，而且你的这个它本身的价值就已经降低到一个两动了，还不能算作一个三动的加减。然后你打出来它之后，你还需要满足你必须有锅，有动物，而且吃一口打一张烤炉。所以总体他的条件太苛刻了。理论上三动，实际上通常是两动。所以说只能放在一个D卡的水平。而且他也并没有什么普适性，大部分情况下这个卡甚至获得两分都很困难，获得两分都要有损失。因为有时候你在没有饲养空间的情况下，房间里那只宠物是不想吃的，吃了的话，你后期又要花一动去把宠物补回来，那是非常亏的。所以说他是在极特殊的卡组里才可以打出。

effect: Instead of a fence piece, you can place 2 wood from your supply on the fence spaces at the edge of your farmyard. These fence spaces with 2 wood are worth 1 bonus point.
During the scoring, if there are at least 2 orthogonally adjacent unused spaces in your farm, you get 2 bonus points. (You still get the negative points for those unused spaces.
chenDesc: 这张卡我还是比较喜欢的。这张卡从收益来讲是两分，两个空地给一分，然后基础给一分，一共两分。一张两分的卡。然后打出条件的，说实话不算太苛刻。就是这个打出条件也不算很高，你有一个陶艺工坊就可以了。陶艺工坊也是相当于，你可以理解为你放弃争夺井的话，你通常是可以争夺到陶艺工坊的。损失大概在0.5分左右，相当于它的净收益还是有1.5分这个样子的。然后没有打出条件，所以这张卡就是没有打，不需要额外的资源，所以这张卡还是不错的。这张卡或提一分上限一分下限，而且能配合一些空地计分的东西。

effect: At any time, you can exchange 1/3/5 grain for 3/4/5 food and 0/1/2 bonus points.
chenDesc: 也算是一张麦子的核心卡。他给的饭非常多，你就有了釜加上麦子你就可以做，就是可以跟很多消耗食物的卡配合。从这个角度来讲还是比较强的。他和这个东方火炉都差不多，算是一档。它们都是能够用一张卡去解决掉很多食物问题。然后你强在他除了解决食物问题之外，它还可以送给你一些分数。但是釜的弱点在于打出条件太苛刻了。就是你首先要有一个砖头，其次你必须先播种完麦田才可以打福。这是一个非常难以达成的事情。你在最需要饭的时间里很难享受到釜给的饭，这是一件非常尴尬的事情。

effect: The next time you take animals from an accumulation space and accommodate all of them on your farm, you get 1 bonus point for each of these animals.
chenDesc: 是极其优质的分数，两分是它的基本收益，大多数情况下这张卡是一个无条件两分，而且他可以有四分的梦想，有上限有下限，愿不愿意为绕着他做就看后面的发牌，后面你发一张饲养空间卡，直接用它做到四分五分都是可能的，所以说这张卡总体收益还是比较高的。但是嗯这个也是一张环境卡，就是看环境里大家吃动物的意愿，如果环境里吃动物的选手比较多，或者做饲养空间的选手比较多的话，可能要降到一个C档，但是在环境里面比较正常的环境下的话，它也是有一个B挡的强度的。

effect: Once this game, when you have 9/8/7/6/5/5 sheep on your farm in a 1-/2-3-/4-/5-/6- player game, you immediately get 2 bonus points.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food.
Up until all other farmyard spaces are used, you cannot use the unused spaces that are orthogonally adjacent to your house.
chenDesc: 这张卡就非常简单，特殊配合的强度下值一动，就是说本身三分，起始花一动打出来它然后获得三分，，这就是一个就是也没有啥赚头的事情，，这个限制条件相当于对你无所谓的情况下它是不赚不亏的，不是太强

effect: Each time you use the "Fishing" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain and 1 wood.
Alternate placing 2 wood and 1 wild boar on the next 4 round spaces. You decide what to start with. At the start of these rounds, you get the goods.
This is an action space for all. A player who uses it can exchange 5/7/9 wood for 8 wood and 2/4/7 food. When another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.
Each time you use the "Grain/Vegetable Seed" action space, place 1 food on each of the next 3/2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Add 3 and 4 to the current round and place 2 food on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces and 1 stone on the round space after that. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
Place 2 food on this card. Each time you use a wood accumulation space, move 1 of these food to your supply. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, add 2 food to this card.
Each time after you place an improvement or occupation in front of you, if you then have the same number of improvements and occupations in play, you get 2 food.
Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get a number of food equal to the number of wild boar in your farmyard.
You can only play this card if you have at least as many pasture spaces as the number of completed rounds. If you do, you get a number of food equal to the current round.
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can use this card to exchange your choice of 1 wood for 2 food, or 1 stone for 4 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. Each time after you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 food for each stable you have.
Place 3 food on this card. Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you get 1 food from this card. Each time you renovate restock this card to 3 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. For each vegetable you take from a field in the field phase of a harvest, you also get 1 food.
If you play this card on the "Major Improvement" action space, you immediately get 4 food. Otherwise, you get only 2 food.
Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you can pay 1 grain to place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you use a "Lessons" action space, before paying the occupation cost, you can exchange 1 grain for 4 food.
Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space while the "Fishing" accumulation space is occupied, you get an additional 2 food.
If you paid wood/clay/stone for this card, place 1 grain on each of the next 2/3/4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.
chenDesc: 可能是一张比镰刀还要强的麦子卡。因为谷仓给的太快了，谷仓的麦子甚至可以用来做麦田的东西。它只需要三回合就可以，你拿两个砖打三回合就给你三个麦子。或许可以做麦田、做桶或者做茅草，这些都是可以的。所以谷仓的话，他可以认为是一张就是非常具有普适性的两份收益的卡。算是在B级里都算是比较强的。不过毕竟麦子卡有个问题是麦子卡是相互冲突的，所以通常不是一抓，二抓三抓还不错。

effect: Each time before you take a "Bake Bread" action, you also get 1 grain for each of your people occupying an accumulation space.
At any time, you can pay 4 clay and 2 food. If you do, place 1 vegetable on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the vegetable.
Before the start of each round that ends with a harvest, you can buy one of each of the following crops: 2 Food → 1 Grain; 4 Food → 1 Vegetable
When you play this card, if the number of completed harvests is equal to the number of occupations you played, you immediately get 1 food, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable.
You can sow crops in pastures covering 1 or 2 farmyard spaces. If you do, these pastures are also considered fields and hold 1 and 2 animals less, respectively.
When you play this card, if you have exactly 2/3/4/5 rooms, you immediately get 1 vegetable/food/grain/vegetable.
Each time before you play or build an improvement, you get 1 wood.
chenDesc: 勉强算是梦想卡，然后你有一点基础收益虽然都不算很高。那这个收益就是通常情况下，通常情况下呢就是用一般打六个发展卡，然后他如果在第一个发展卡的位置打出来的话，他们可以获得五个。总算是一张中规中矩的卡牌。他的弱点是在于他需要打出来的时间特别早，把木头其实给的非常远。这个木头兑现速度实在太慢了，而收益也没有那么高。这张卡整体收益高，哪怕你在非常特殊的考试里，他也就是个九个木头左右，而且还会影响你前期的节奏。但是他这个卡超过一动这也是毫无疑问的，C卡里应该没有能够和这个卡一较高下。

effect: Place 1 wood on the next 5 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood. Remove the wood promised by this card from future round spaces the next time you renovate.
chenDesc: 这是一张和木材车间比较像的卡。这张卡应该是要比木材车间是要更强一点的。就是天花板和木材车间相比的话，因为天花板给的快。虽然他这个限制条件也算是一个有条件，但是有时候有四个也未尝不可。你在打出来他的下一回合给一个木头这件事，其实是就是会让你在生娃打发展卡这件事情有更多的选择空间。收益和车间差不多，多一个限制条件但是给的快。大部分情况下应该比木材之间略强一点，但是总体上是一个级别的卡。

effect: Place 1 reed on each of the remaining space for rounds 5, 8, 10, and 12. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.
Each time any player (including you) takes at least 3 stone from an accumulation space, you get 1 stone from the general supply.
Before each work phase, you can take 1 building resource from at most one wood/clay/reed/stone accumulation space containing at least 6/5/4/4 building resources of the same type.
chenDesc: 大致情况下应该还是能够获得两次，但是要求打的时间太早，就导致一张非常的发展卡的话，能够拿两到三个资源不是很能令人满意。而且也是一个同样的问题，就是给的时间太拖，导致他基本上就变成了一张特殊的配合。不过你拿他和那张就是567的资源给木头砖头的那个职业相比的话，大家都没有配合情况下，还是手拉车要强一点。就是如果你没有其他想要打的前期发展卡的话，那你把手拉车打出来可能是要比一个一分白板的效果要好，这就是它的意义。

effect: After each harvest, you can buy exactly one of the following goods: 1 Food → 1 Wood; 1 Food → 1 Clay; 2 Food → 1 Reed; 2 Food → 1 Stone
Pile (from bottom to top) 1 wild boar, 1 food, 1 cattle, 1 food, and 1 sheep on this card. At any time, you can pay 1 clay to take the top good.
chenDesc:
效果：优质一三白板
强度：和这个和这个牛头骨差不多，俩都是优质一分版本。

effect: Once you have 4 field tiles arranged in a 2x2, you can use a "Build Stables" action to build a stable in the center of the 2x2. This stable provides room for a person but no animal.
This card can hold a number of wild boar equal to the number of completed feeding phases.
If your house has exactly 2 rooms, immediately renovate it without paying any building resources. If you do, you can immediately afterward take a "Build Fences" action.
Each time you use the "Farmland" action space while the "Grain Seeds" action space is occupied, you can plow 1 additional field.
From Round 5 on, each time you use the "sheep Market" accumulation space, you can also take a "Family Growth with Room Only" action.
Place 1 food from your supply on each of the next 2, 3, or 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food back and your choice of a "sow" or "Build Fences" action.
Each time before you use the "Fencing" action space, you get 2 wood. Immediately after that "Fencing" action, you can place another person.
Place 1 wood on each of the next 2 odd-numbered round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood and, immediately afterward, a "Minor Improvement" action.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each card played after this on that has "accumulation space(s)" in its text.
Each harvest, if any player (including you) owns the Joinery or an upgrade thereof, you can buy exactly 1 bonus point for 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 reed. Each time you decline a "Minor/Major Improvement" action, you get 1 food/vegetable instead.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 good of each of the following types, If you have at least 2 of that good in your supply already, food, grain, vegetable, reed, wood.
Immediately before the start of each round, if there are goods on the remaining round space that are promised to you, you get 1 food.
At the end of each preparation phase, if you have at least 1 stone in your supply, you get 1 food. In round 14, you get 1 vegetable instead.
For each clay room you build, you get 2 food and 1 bonus point. (this does not apply to stone rooms and renovated wood rooms.)
Each time you use the action space card that has been revealed right before the most recent harvest, you also get 1 grain.
When you play this card, you can choose to buy 1 grain for 1 food, or 1 vegetable for 3 food. This card is a field.
You can hold 1 additional animal in each pasture without a stable. Each time you sow in a field, you can place 1 additional crop of the respective type in that field.
When you play this card and each time 1 reed is placed on an empty "Reed Bank" accumulation space in the preparation phase, you get 1 wood.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. After each work phase, if you have more stone than clay in your supply, you get 1 wood.
You immediately get 1 wood. Additionally, place 1 wood on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of fences you built. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.
Each time before you use the action space card left of the card that has been most recently placed on a round space, you get 2 clay.
Each time you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you also get 1 of the other good, stone/clay.
In each work phase, after you enclose at least one farmyard space, you get 2 stone. (Subdividing an existing pasture does not count.)
Place 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 stone in this order on the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective building resource.
When you play this card in round 5 or later, you can immediately pay 1 stone, 1 grain, 1 vegetable, and 1 sheep to take a "Family Growth Even without Room" action.
Each time after you use the "Major Improvement" action space, you can take a "renovation" action, paying 2 clay or 2 stone less for the renovation.
You can use the action space on round space 13 even if it is occupied by one or more people of the players to your immediate left and right.
Each time after you use the "Grain Utilization" or "Fencing" action space while the other is unoccupied, you can pay 1 food to use the other space with the same person.
Immediately after each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can play a minor improvement.
Once you have no unused farmyard spaces left, you get 1 bonus point for each vegetable that you harvest.
At the start of scoring, you get a number of vegetables equal to the smallest of the numbers of major improvements, minor improvements, and occupations you have.
After playing this card, if you renovate to stone in round 13/12/11 or before, you immediately get 1/2/3 food and 1/2/3 bonus points.
At the start of each round, you can exchange a set comprised of 1 animal of any type, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable for 5 food and 2 bonus points.
Place 1 vegetable, 1 wild boar, 1 stone, and 1 cattle on this card. Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get the corresponding good from this card.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. Each time before another player takes at least 5 wood from an accumulation space, they must first pay you 1 food.
In the returning home phase of each round, if there is no wood left on the game board, you get 1 food—from round 5 on, even 2 food.
At the end of each work phase in which you placed at least 1 good on 1 of your farmyard spaces, you get 2 food.
When you play this card, you can immediately exchange 0/1/3 clay for 1/2/3 grain. This card is a field.
Each time another player uses the "Hollow" accumulation space, you get 1 clay. In a 3-/4-player game, you also get 1 additional clay/food.
Each time after you use the "Clay Pit" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you get 1 wood. On "Clay Pit" you also get 1 additional reed.
Each time you use a building resource accumulation space, you can discard exactly 1 card from your hand to get 1 additional building resource of the accumulating type.
Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can pay 1 grain to get 1 wild boar.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 sheep. You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation in front of you.
When you play this card, you remove exactly 3 stables in your supply from play to build a pasture covering 2 farmyard spaces. You only need to pay a total of 2 wood for fences
Each time after you use the "Farm Expansion" or "Major Improvement" action space while the other is unoccupied, you can pay 1 food to use that other space with the same person.
You immediately get 1 stone. As long as you live in a wooden house with exactly 2 rooms, actions spaces—excluding Meeting Place—are not considered occupied for you.
Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can pay 1 food to use an unoccupied "Traveling Players" or "Lessons" action space with the same person.
During scoring, total the point values of your major improvements. The smallest value counts double. If the total is at least 5/7/9/11, you get 1/2/3/4 bonus points.
You can only play this card if you have less than 7 sheep. Once this game, when you have 7 sheep on your farm, you immediately get 3 bonus points and 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 reed. Each time you pay an occupation cost, you can use food from the "traveling Players" accumulation space.
At any time, you can pay 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from you farm. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 3/5/7 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
At the end of each work phase, if you used both the "Forest" and "Grove" accumulation spaces, you get 5 food.
For each field tile that another player places next to an existing field tile, you get 1 food from the general supply. In round 14, you get 1 grain instead.
Immediately, when you play this card, and at the end of each work phase, in which the "Forest", "Clay Pit", and "Reed Bank" accumulation spaces are all occupied, you get 1 grain.
Each time it is your turn in the work phase, if there are one or more accumulation spaces with 5+ goods on them and you do not use any of them, you get 1 vegetable.
Each time you obtain exactly 2/3/4 wood from a wood accumulation space, you get 1 additional wood and 1/0/1 food.
Immediately before each harvest, you can discard 1/3/4 grain from different fields to get 1/2/3 wild boars.
When you play this card, you can pay 2 food to get 1 sheep, 1 wild boar, and 1 cattle, but only if you can accommodate all three animals on your farm.
Each time you renovate, you get 2 food and 1 additional animal of the respective type in each of your pastures with stable.
Immediately raze all of your fences, add up to 3 fences from your supply, and rebuild them. (You do not lose any animals during this.)
You immediately get 1 wood for each occupation you have in front of you.
You immediately get 1 clay for each clay room and for each major improvement you have.
You immediately get your choice of 3 food or 1 food for each sheep you have. (Keep the sheep.)
In each field with exactly 1 good, you can immediately place 1 additional good of the same type.
If you can accommodate the animal, you can immediately buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 0/1/2 food.
Once you have 4 rooms, your house can hold 5 people.
chenDesc:
效果：无条件预防
强度：算是一张就是无条件预防，无条件一空间的卡。我觉得他相比这个比这个铁锤，上下铺比铁锤要更强一点。它比铁锤可以更晚打出来，然后在两个都是都是不违建，因为铁锤毕竟违建成可能性更高。东西没见的情况下，上下铺和水相比的就是少了一个法师的分数，但是上下普攻打出来的非常稳，而且具有稳定性，可以偷袭。第二资源还是少几个的，就综合这两点的话，它比铁锤应该是要强的，可以放在这个位置。

effect: For each pasture you have, you can keep 1 cattle on this card.
On your first renovation, if you have at least 5 wood rooms, you can renovate to stone directly and you get a discount of 2 stone on the renovation cost.
Each time before you use the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you can take a "Build Fences" action. (You must pay wood for the fences as usual.)
When you play this card, you can immediately plow 1 field, which needs not be adjacent to another field.
At any time, if you have at least 3 planted fields, you can discard all goods from one of those fields to plow 1 field.
Each time you use the "Farmland" or "Cultivation" action space, you can plow 1 additional field.
Each time a "Quarry" accumulation space is revealed, if you have room in your house, you can immediately take a "Family Growth" action without placing a person.
When you play this card, you can immediately move the first person you placed this work phase to this card. If you do, immediately afterward, you can place another person.
If both are unoccupied, you can use the "Day Laborer" and the adjacent "Lessons" action space with a single person (in that order). Afterward, both spaces are considered occupied.
At the start of the next harvest, you get a "Family Growth" action if you have room for the newborn.
Each time you use the "Major Improvement" or "House Redevelopment" action space, you can also play 1 occupation at an occupation cost of 1 food.
At the end of the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to get 2 bonus points. If you do, all other players get 1 food each.
During scoring, you get a number of bonus points equal to the total of negative points you have, to a maximum of 7 bonus points.
You can no longer play this card when any player (including you) has 5 or more cards in front of them.
During scoring, if you then have at least 2/4/5/6 unplanted fields, you get 1/2/3/5 bonus points.
Immediately after each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 reed for 1 bonus point.
Immediately after each time you use a clay accumulation space, you can exchange 1 clay for 1 bonus point. If you do, place the clay on the accumulation space.
enDesc:
Clay Deposit Clay Deposit 1F is often well worth 5 clay, so you need to be
careful about when, if ever, you play this card. You don't want to be giving
your opponents options! Moreover, the benefit this gives you is just about as
dubious - even if you want clay, if you spend an action to play it and an
action to use it, you've spent 2 actions for 5 clay - that's pretty mediocre.
The choice to take 2 VP is fine fine , but usually you'll have a way to do that anyway, whether
it's by plowing fields or taking singleton animals to stay in your home. Overall, the high occupation requirement, zero VPs
and questionable benefit makes it one of the worst cards you can draw. The only
real use I see for it is as a desperation move in 2-p, after your opponent has
denied you clay.

effect: When you play this card, all other players get 1 food each.
Each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you also get 1 bonus point. In games with 1-3 players, this card is considered "Traveling Players" (same effect as "Fishing").
When you play this card paying grain/reed for it, you immediately get 1 vegetable/4 wood.
chenDesc:
效果：优质前期卡
强度：就是这个优质前期卡。帆布袋这张卡，他在这个前期，他和这个他这两个东西是收益差不多。这个东西多一分，然后这个东西后期资源稍微多一点，他俩收益差不多，算是同一个级别的。就是看你能拿到的是RSF还是三个。感觉相比来讲的话，这个的打出条件要比帆布袋要更低一点，毕竟帆布袋要求四职业。

effect: Each time you build a major improvement, place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, also place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Once per round, you can pay 1 vegetable to get 1 bonus point. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to three times the number of planted fields you have. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
After each turn in which you make at least one unused farmyard space used, you get 1 food.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, for each empty unfenced stable you have, you can exchange 1 grain for 5 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food for each completed round left to play. At any time, you can exchange 1 sheep plus 1 wild boar for 1 cattle.
For each new wild boar you get from the effect of an action space, you also get 1 food.
Each time you use a cooking improvement to turn 2 goods into food at the same time, you get 1 additional food.
After the field phase of each harvest, you can exchange 1 grain plus 1 fence (both from your supply) for 5 food.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood/clay/stone into 2/2/3 food.
chenDesc:
效果：食物
强度：这个卡我用的不多，但是他的兑换效率还是可以接受的。算是一张比较弱的方法，用的不多，我其实也不太好评价吧，就防着点。

effect: When you play this card, you can immediately buy exactly 1 vegetable for 3 food. At any time, you can discard 1 vegetable on top of another vegetable in a field to get 4 food.
chenDesc:
效果：蔬菜
强度：他这张卡变魔术的情况有点少啊，一般情况下就和这俩卡算是一个级别。

effect: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, if immediately afterward you have at most 5 wood in your supply, you get 1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 5 food. Each time before you get a "Bake Bread" action, you can build the "Clay Oven" or "stone Oven" major improvement.
Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can use this card once to turn 1 grain into 2 food and 1 bonus point.
Each harvest, you can use each of your cooking improvements once to get double the amount of food for 1 animal or vegetable.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1 grain from your supply plus 1 grain from a field for 2 bonus points and 4 food.
Once per round, you can pay 1 grain to place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
After each harvest in which you have 2 or 3+ grain in your supply, you get 1 food and 1 additional grain, respectively.
At the start of each round that does not end with a harvest, if you have at least 1 sheep in a pasture, you get 1 grain.
At any time, you can exchange 3 grain in a field for 1 vegetable in that field.
In the breeding phase of each harvest, if you get newborn animals of at least two types, you also get a "Sow" action.
When you play this card, immediately carry out the field phase of the harvest. Afterwards, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action.
Each time after you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 grain from the general supply. From round 11 on, you can get 1 vegetable instead.
In the returning home phase of each round, place 1 wood on this card. Each time before you build a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth, or oven, move up to 4 wood from this card to your supply.
Each time you plow a field (tile or card), you can also buy 1 stone for 1 food.
Immediately place 2 of each building resource on this card. Each time any player (including you) takes at least 5 wood, 4 clay, 3 reed, or 3 stone, you get 1 of that building resource from this card.
Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can pay 2 food total to buy 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 stone.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 cattle.
Each round that does not end with a harvest, you can pay 1 grain to breed exactly 1 type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)
When you live in a clay or stone house, you can pay 1 grain and 2 food. If you do, for the rest of the game, this card provides room for exactly one person.
Wood rooms cost you 2 woods less. Your 3rd and 4th stable each cost you 1 wood less. Your 13th to 15th fence each cost you nothing.
Each time you use the "Farmland" or "Cultivation" action space with the first person you place in a round, you can plow 1 additional field for 1 food.
Immediately before each harvest, if you have room in your house, you can take a "Family Growth" action for 3 food.
Each time you use the "Forest" or "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you can place 1 stone from the general supply on the other space. If you do, you can immediately place another person.
At any time, you can take the "Build Stables" action without placing a person. If you do, each stable costs you 1 wood and 1 food.
When you play this card, immediately build the "Basketmaker's Workshop" major improvement for 1 stone and 1 reed.
Each time any people return from both the "Grain Seeds" and "Vegetable Seeds" action spaces, you get 2 food and you can play 1 occupation, without paying an occupation cost.
At the start of scoring, you can place food in empty fields. You get 1/2/3 bonus points for each field in which you place 1/4/7 food.
If you play this card in round 11 or before, during scoring, you get 4 bonus points if you then have more rooms than people.
Once per round, if you have 0/1/2/3/4 unfenced stables on your farm, you can exchange 2 grain for 1 bonus point and 1/2/3/4/5 food.
Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can place 4 wood from your supply on that space to get 2 stone, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 grain.

At the start of each round, you can make exactly one of the following exchanges: 1 Cattle → 1 Vegetable; 1 Vegetable → 1 Cattle; 2 Sheep → 1 Vegetable; 1 Vegetable → 2 Sheep; 2 Food → 1 Grain; 1 Grain → 2 Food
Once each harvest, you can buy 1 wood, 1 reed, and 1 grain for 2 food total.
Before the start of each round, if you have food equal to or higher than the current round number (e.g., 8+ food in round 8), you get 1 food.
Each time after you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you can place 1 stone/2 clay from your supply on the space to get 2 grain/1 vegetable, respectively.
Each time you build a major improvement, place 1 reed from the general supply on that card. At any time, you can move the reed to your supply or exchange it for a "Sow" action.
Each time you use an action space that is orthogonally adjacent to another action space occupied by one of your people, you get 1 wood.
Place 8 clay on this card. For each grain you obtain, you also get 1 clay from this card.
In the breeding phase of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, you can use this card to buy exactly 2 stone for 2/2/3/3/4/1 food.
Before the start of each work phase, you can place a person on an accumulation space of a building resource not in your supply. (Then proceed with the start player.)
When you play this card, immediately pay an amount of food equal to the number of complete rounds left to play to take a "Family Growth Even without Room" action.
enDesc:
Lover Extra cost: 4 food Ah, the infamous lover. Certainly, in reports like this tournament thread tournament thread ,
he seems to be unfair. In the game, a player plays turn 2 lover and is able to
seemingly coast to victory. Without a doubt, the Lover is one of the best
occupations in the game. But is he broken? Playing the lover is pretty much impossible on round 1, so by 'early lover
action,' people generally mean rounds 2, 3 or 4, with the most infamous starts
coming in round 2. If you play it round 2, you're going to need to take
day-laborer once just to play it. Afterwards, you'll have either 1 or 0 food
and will need to secure 6 food by the end of the harvest. This should take at
least 2 more actions. What does this mean? You've spent 4 actions to get 2
actions before the first harvest! Another weakness with the Early Lover is that his house is still 2 rooms! A
player who grows his family the old fashioned way has the option of building a
4th room to his house and growing again. On the other hand, the Early Lover is
stuck with his 2 room house - he's going to need 10 wood and 4 reed before he
can grow his family again. If he decides to eschew further 'fair' family growth
and wait for 'Family Growth without Room,' he suffers from the fact that his 2
room house is pretty much unsuitable for renovation - there just won't be many
points in it. The final weakness is that playing the Lover early puts a giant bulls-eye on
your head. If your opponents are strong, they will be looking to screw you out
of food at every possible avenue. That said, what makes the Early Lover strong is that while he is scrambling for
food, he is also using his extra actions to take resources off of the board.
The result is that while his farm might not look all that impressive, no one
else's will either! Pretty much everyone will be gimped by the Lover's
inefficient scrambling, and by the end the Lover himself usually comes out
ahead. Playing the Lover on turn 2 is an all-in play - you are either going to win
because of the play or lose because of it. An interesting alternative is to
forgo playing him until around stage 3. Usually by this time, you have grown
your family once and have some sort of a food engine up. Hopefully, you can
then grab either 3 sheep or a piled fishing spot and use it to play the card.
Used this way, the Lover is safer and still a strong play, but doesn't have the
swingy potential that playing him early does.

effect: You can use the "Urgent Wish for Children" action space (from round 12-13) even if it is occupied by the first person another player placed.
Each time you use the "Grove" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you can place 2 reed from the general supply on the other space. If you do, you can immediately place another person.
Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space when any "Lessons" action space is occupied, you can also play an occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.
When you renovate to stone, you can place up to 1 wood from your supply in each of your rooms. During scoring, each such wood is worth 1 bonus point.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each stone-wood pair in your supply. You cannot score additional points for the resources scored with this card.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each space in your farmyard (including rooms) holding at least 1 cattle.
If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with a pasture of highest capacity gets 3 bonus points.
On the "Day Laborer" action space, you also get your choice of 1 sheep or 1 grain. Instead of that good, you can buy 1 wild boar for 1 food or 1 cattle for 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 reed and 1 food. At any time, you can turn 1 reed into 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. Each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action, you can take a "Bake Bread" action instead.
Each time any player (including you) uses the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, you get 1 grain.
When you play this card, you can immediately buy exactly 2 stone for 1 food. From the next round on, one per round, you can buy 1 stone for 2 food.
enDesc:
Stone Buyer This is the most tempting resource buyer to play, simply because stone is the
most valuable resource in the game. Still, in order for him to be worth it,
you're going to need a good early source of food to take advantage of the
people using the RSF spot. You're also going to need a way to use that stone in
the early game. Usually, he doesn't seem worth it.

effect: Each time after any player (including you) uses the unoccupied "Grove" or "Forest" accumulation space while the other of the two is occupied, you get 1 reed.
Place a unique pair of different building resources on each of your improvements. Each time another player renovates, you may move one such pair to your supply.
Each time you use an accumulation space, place 1 clay from the general supply on this card. You must immediately exchange 4 clay on this card for 1 wild boar, held by this card.
On your turn, if you pay 1 grain to the general supply, you can use the same action space that the player to your right has just used on their turn.
Each time after another player uses the "Grain Utilization" action space, you get a "Sow" action.
Each time you use one of the two accumulation spaces for the same type of good containing exactly the same number of goods, you can also buy 1 bonus point for 1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain and, at the start of this returning home phase, an amount of food equal to the number of occupied action space cards.
Immediately add 1 cattle from the general supply to the "Cattle Market" accumulation space. Afterward, you get 1 grain plus 1 food for each cattle on "Cattle Market".
Before the start of each round, if you have more building resources than all other players of at least two types, you get 1 food.
Each time before you place a person, if there are at least 8 wood total on accumulation spaces, you get 1 food.
At the start of each round, if there is more food on the "Traveling Players" than on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get the difference from the general supply.
Each time before you use the action space on the most recently revealed action space card (after it has been placed on the round space), you get 1 grain.
enDesc:
Outrider In my opinion this is one of the coolest occupations in the deck, even if he's
nowhere near the most powerful. If you're planning on baking, you can use him
to give you nice bonuses with the grain that you were otherwise going to spend
an action on. Later, when you (hopefully) are taking Family Growth, Family
Growth Without Room and Plow and/or Sow as they come out, you'll get an
additional bonus. At the end of the game, if you've gotten 3 grain out of him, he was probably
worth the action.

effect: When you play this card, if you have at least 2/4/5 unplanted field tiles, you immediately get 1/2/3 vegetables.
This card is an action space for all. If another player uses it, they get 3 wood and must give you 1 wood from the general supply. If you use it, you get 4 wood.
Each time any player (including you) takes 5/6/7/8+ goods from an accumulation space, you get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone from the general supply.
Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you get 1 sheep from the general supply.
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, instead of 2 food, you can get 3 different animals from the general supply. If you do, you must pay 1 food each harvest left to play.
You can immediately plow 1 field such that it completes a "zigzag" pattern.
You can immediately take a "Renovation" action.
You can immediately sow in exactly 1 field.
You immediately get 1 clay for each planted field you have.
Immediately exchange up to 3 wood for 1 stone each.
You get 2 food and 1 grain, which you must sow immediately.
Your pastures of size 1 can hold up to 3 animals of the same type. (With a stable, they can hold up to 6 animals of the same type.)
At any time, you can renovate your house to stone. From a wooden house, this costs 1 stone, 1 reed, and 1 food per room. From a clay house, this costs 1 stone per room.
Immediately before you renovate to stone, you get 2 clay and 1 reed and you can take a "Build Rooms" action.
Each time before you use the "Sheep Market"/"Cattle Market" accumulation space, you can build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood/at no cost.
Each time before you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you can pay 3 food to plow 1 field.
Immediately after each returning home phase, you can pay 2 wood and 1 food to use the "Farmland" action space without placing a person.
Immediately after each time you use a clay accumulation space, you can pay 1 clay to plow 1 field. If you do, place that 1 clay on the accumulation space.
Provided you have room in your house, each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action, you can take a "Family Growth" action instead.
Add 1 to the current round for each building resource you have and place 1 person from your supply on the corresponding round space. In that round, you can use the person.
This card is an action space for you only. In rounds 3-5, it provides a "renovation" action. In rounds 6-8, it provides your choice of 1 vegetable, wild boar, or cattle.
As long as you have exactly 4 people, in the work phase of each round, you can place your third and fourth person immediately after one another, even on the same action space.
This card is a field that you can sow in, an occupation, and the "Fireplace" major improvement with all of its effects. You can play it only via a "Minor Improvement" action.
You can build the "Joinery" and "Well" major improvement even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action, or you can build both with a single "Major Improvement" action.
At the end of each turn in which you renovate, you can exchange your Joinery for the Pottery or your Pottery for the Basketmaker's Workshop.
During scoring, you get 2/5/8 bonus points for having 3/4/5 major improvements from the bottom row of the supply board.
During scoring, you get 1/2 bonus point for each pair of grain plus vegetable you have (considering all crops in your supply and fields), rounded up.
During scoring, if you had at least 7 goods in your fields before the final harvest, you get 2 bonus points.
During scoring, if you live in a stone house, you get 2 bonus points for each unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your house. (You still lose the points for these unused spaces.)
During scoring, if you then have more stone rooms than people, you get 4 bonus points. You can only use one card to get bonus points for your stone house.
During scoring in a game with 1/2/3/4+ players, you get 1 bonus point for every 7th/5th/4th/3rd animal on your farm.
During scoring, if you gained at most 2 sheep from sources other than breeding during the game and have not turned any sheep into food, you get 3 bonus points.
Alternate placing 1 clay and 1 wild boar on each remaining round space, starting with clay. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to the amount of wood in your supply. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Once per round, you can pay 1 reed. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 2 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food. (*Occupations and Improvements)
Before the start of each round, if you have more occupations than improvements in your hand, you get 1 food.

This card is an action space for all. A player who uses it immediately gets 1 food. Immediately before the returning home phase, they can use an unoccupied action space with the person from this card.
In the returning home phase of each round, if you have more clay than wood in your supply, you get 1 food.
Once per round, you can skip placing your second person and get 1 food instead. (You can place the person later that round.)
chenDesc: 就是二分卡，没啥好说的。比较优质的二分卡的。这个打打出来一定是后期打的，就是前期打出来获取食物的话，第二个往往会年轻人，我觉得损失是有点大的。你在二三期的话，第二个娃，然后就因为每一次开一个食物，其实都就只有一季的一个食物是价值比较高的。从第三集开始，这个食物肯定不值得你的第二个娃娃后一点，他就是当做一张两分传递的。

effect: At the start of each work phase, if there are at least 3 food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 1 food from the general supply.
Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get 1 additional food.
Each time you turn a sheep or wild boar into food using a cooking improvement, you get 1 additional food.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
At the end of each action in which you sow vegetables in a field, you get 1 food for each vegetable field you have (including the new ones).
At any time: Vegetable → 3 Food; Sheep → 2 Food; Wild boar → 3 Food; Cattle → 3 Food "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
At any time: Clay → 2 Food Scoring: 3/5/6/7 Clay → 1/2/3/4 bonus points
At the start of each harvest, if you have at least 3 grain fields (including field cards with planted grain), you get 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can turn 2/3/4 grain into 3/6/9 food.
In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each harvested field tile that is orthogonally adjacent to your house.
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can take a "Bake Bread" action. "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
In the field phase of each harvest, if you harvest at least 2 grain, you get 1 additional grain from the general supply.
Place 1 grain on each of the next 3 of the round spaces 4, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 14. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.
Each time you use the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can pay 1 reed to get 1 vegetable. If you do in a game with 4+ players, place that 1 reed on the accumulation space.
Before the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to add 1 vegetable to each of up to 2 vegetable fields.
At any time, if a field contains exactly 1 good as a result of a harvest, you can discard that good and immediately take a "Sow" action limited to that field.
chenDesc:
效果：更换作物
强度：通常来讲收益在一分，很少有其他的效果。毕竟弃掉一个旧物，这个损失挺大的。一般就发作一次，发动四的话，你更换掉三个麦田，就是可以获得01:05分的收益，这就是它的效果。不过一般来讲是在单卡，基本上是当一份白板用。有国外的话，他就是还能额外这个抢一下那个园林、绿化之类的。都是绿化园林，还有菜最多之类的东西，你可以在最后一集做一个突袭。总体强度比浓度偏强，但是在一分白板的这个位置。

effect: In the field phase of each harvest, you can harvest 1 additional good from a number of fields equal to the number of unfenced stables you have.
At the end of each turn in which you use the "Farm Expansion" action space or build an improvement, you get 1 wood back for every 2 wood paid during those actions (rounded down).
Immediately after the feeding phase of each harvest, if you have no food left, you get 1 wood and 1 clay.
Each time after you build an improvement costing at least 2 clay, you get 1 stone.
Each time you renovate, you pay 1 fewer reed and, at the end of the action, you get 1 stone.
Each time you use the "Fencing" action space, you also get 1 wild boar.
As soon as you have 6 occupations in front of you (including this one), this cards provides room for one person. In the draft variant, you need 7 occupations to play this.
You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation card in front of you (including this one), unless it is already able to hold animals.
From round 5 on, if you have room in your house, at the end of each person action, you can take a "Family Growth" action with that person. If you do, you get 2 negative points.
Once per work phase, after you complete a person action, you can pay 1 sheep and 2 food to return another person you placed home.
Each time you take a "Build Rooms" action with the second person you place, return the first person you placed home, unless it is on the "Meeting Place" action space.
When you play this card, immediately build a major improvement. When paying its cost, you can replace up to 1 building resource of each type with 1 food each.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, after the final harvest, you get 1 bonus point for each person for which you then pay 1 clay.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each scoring category in which you score the maximum 4 points. (The bonus point is also awarded for 4 fenced stables.)
enDesc:
Lord of the Manor Keep in mind that Agricola tends to reward people who don't focus on maxing
specific areas, and instead rewards last-minute diversification. As a result
you generally won't have much incentive for maxing areas with the intention of
getting points on this guy, because you could probably be getting just as many
points by filling in negatives. That said, you only really need 3 areas maxed for him to be worth the action.
This is most easily done with Fields, Grain, and Veggies, for obvious reasons.
If you've been able to do this, by all means play him.

effect: At the start of each returning home phase, you can return a built stable to your supply to get 1 wood, 1 grain, 1 food, and a "Minor Improvement" action.
Each time you use "Fishing" or "Reed Bank", you can pay 1 food to immediately place another person on this card. If you do, you get your choice of 3 stone or 1 grain plus 1 vegetable.
Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get 1 food. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, you also get 1 grain.
At any time, you can pay 1 grain. If you do, add 2 to the current round and place 4 food on the corresponding round space. At the start of that round, you get the food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time after you use an action space with the "Sow" action, you get 2 food.
Each time there is 1/2/3+ food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 2 food on the "Reed Bank"/ "Clay Pit"/ "Grove" accumulation spaces.
Each time you use the "Major Improvement" action space, you also get 1 grain and, afterward, you can take a "Sow" action.
For each grain you harvest from a field, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3 food. If you harvest the last grain from a field, the vegetable costs you only 2 food.
This card is a "1 Wood" accumulation space for you only. Each time the newly revealed action space card is a "Quarry" accumulation space, you must discard all wood from this card.
For each new wood/clay room you build, you get 2 clay/2 stone.
At any time, you can place a good from your supply on this card to get 1 stone. You must place different goods on this card. (Food is also considered a good.)
Each time you use a wood or clay accumulation space, you can also buy exactly 1 building resource. Wood, clay, and reed cost 1 food each; stone costs 2 food.
Pile 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, 1 stone, 1 reed, 1 clay, and 1 wood on this card. Each time you harvest a field tile, you can also take the top good from the pile.
This card is an action space for you only. If each other player has more rooms than you, it provides the "Day Laborer", "Building Rooms", and "Major Improvement" actions (all three).
Each harvest in which you have at least 5 wood in your supply, you can discard down to 5 wood to take a "Build Stables" or "Build Wood Rooms" action by paying the usual costs.
At the end of each work phase in which you did not use the "Meeting Place" action space, you can take a "Build Rooms" action without placing a person.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 stone. You can build any of the major improvements in the bottom row of the supply board even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn 1 wood plus 1 grain into 1 bonus point and 2 food.
Each time the "Fishing" accumulation space is used, you get 1 bonus point and must skip placing your next person that round. (You can place the person on a later turn.)
If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most vegetables in their fields gets 2 bonus points.
If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most fenced stables gets 2 bonus points.
Each time after you use a "Lesson" action space, you can buy up to 2 different goods: grain, stone, sheep, and wild boar for 1 food each; cattle and vegetable for 2 food each.
Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, both they and you get 1 food (before taking the actions). If you use it, you get 1 food.
Each time you take at least 4 building resources or 4 animals from an accumulation space, you also get 1 food.
At the end of each work phase in which you occupy the "Clay Pit" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space while the respective other is unoccupied, you get 1 vegetable.
Each time you use an accumulation space providing at least 3 goods of the same type except wood, you get an additional 1 wood. (Food is also considered a good.)
When you play this card, if you have 1/2/3/4 major improvements, you immediately get 2/3/4/5 reed.
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, place 1 food, 1 food, and 1 wild boar on the next 3 round spaces, respectively. At the start of these rounds, you get the good.
Each time another player uses a "Quarry" accumulation space, you can choose to get 1 food or build a stable without paying wood.
Each time you take a "Family Growth" action with the second person you place in a round, return the first person you placed home.
Immediately after each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can place another person on an action space of your choice, regardless whether or not the action space is occupied.
At the start of each of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, if you have at least 1/2/3/4/5/6 grain fields, you get 1 bonus point.
Each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood into 1 food and 1 grain.
Place 3 grain and 3 food on this card. Each time you use the "Resource Market" action space, you also get 1 grain and 1 food from this card.
As soon as the next player but you gains their 5th person, you immediately get 8 food (not retroactively). During scoring, if only you have 5 people, you get 3 bonus points.
At any time, you can turn 1 reed into 3 food. Any other player can prevent this by buying the reed for 2 food from you. If multiple players are interested, choose one.
Each time another player uses the first person they place in a round to take a "Family Growth" action, you get 1 grain from the general supply.
enDesc:
Midwife If you are in a position where you are going to get a lot of food from the
Midwife, you are not going to win.

effect: Each time any player (including you) renovates and the builds no/ 1 minor/ 1 major improvement, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3/2/1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 stone. Each time another player renovates to stone or builds a stone room, you get 1 stone.
Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if afterward you have no animal in your house, you also get 1 sheep.
Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if you occupy either the action space immediately above or below that accumulation space, you also get 1 wild boar.
Each time you build at least 2 stables on the same turn, you also get 1 cattle.
You immediately get 1 wood. After each round that does not end with a harvest, you can breed exactly one type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)
You can immediately build up to 3 stables at no cost.
Immediately renovate to clay at no cost. (You must pay the cost of this card though.)
Immediately return your person on the "Grain Utilization" action space home; you can place it again later this round.
Immediately remove all grain from one of your fields to the general supply. Gain 2 wood for each grain you just removed.
Immediately remove exactly 2 different building resources from accumulation spaces and place them in your supply.
You immediately get 1 building resource of each type of which you have 4 or more resources in your supply already.
You immediately get 4 food. (Effectively, you are turning 1 grain into 4 food.)
You immediately get 1 vegetable. (Effectively, you are buying 1 vegetable for 2 food.)
Up to two times: Immediately spend any 2/3/4 building resources for 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from the general supply.
At the end of the work phases of rounds 3 and 6, you can move your person from the "Farmland" action space to an unoccupied action space and take that action, or get 1 food.
As long as you have a pasture orthogonally adjacent to your house, you can keep animals of any type on this card, up to the number of rooms in your house.
chenDesc: 纯垃圾

effect: You can keep 1 additional animal (of the same type) in each of your unfenced stables, and 2 additional animals (of the same type) in each pasture with stable.
At any time, you can renovate your clay house to a stone house without placing a person. (You must pay the normal renovation cost.)
Each time all other players have more people than you, you can take a "Build Rooms" action without placing a person.
Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can place 1 stone from your supply on that space (for the next visitor) to take a “Build Fences” action.
You do not need to pay wood for fences that you build on the edge of your farmyard board.
chenDesc:
效果：木头系天花板
强度：这张卡给的木头实在是太多了。这张卡可以给就是整整八根木头。如果你为八的话，可以给八根木头，如果为六的话，可以给七个木。就是只要你不是五房加大理的情况下，经济一半都是老赖全的一张核心卡。它的使用率比手机版还要高，而且还不传递。你只要抓了几张卡的话，你后期就几乎不需要为木头而担心，你只需要考虑怎么样能够把这张卡做出来。做出来的情况下通常会亏一动，但是你在亏一动的情况下，你可以获得一个接近于股东的收益，至少是四动的收益。但这也是非常令人满意的一件事情。而且本身你对一个圈地卡组来讲，就是如果说你是晚回卡组，那你肯定不能指望你围完再去拿木头。所以说他在一个网页卡组里，他对那个副作用是非常小，它甚至可以认为是近战系统的一张卡。

effect: Each time you use the "Farmland" or "Cultivation" action space, you can plow 2 fields instead of 1. Each time you sow, you must place 1 fewer good on each field you sow.
Each time after you play a minor improvement after this one, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
chenDesc:
效果：五动核心卡
强度：这是一个五动核心卡，超级大核心只值五动的超级大核心。他和他的理论收益升级，当然一芦苇的这个成本的话，也是算是一张四分卡。这个经济提高是一样的收益，但是比经济比钢要难做一点。因为他必须作为第一个发展，他就是至少是第二个方向，他打字也就意味着你要在生娃前打够四个职业。这个还是比较难凑的，通常普通话这个是要亏生娃的顺位的。但是你打出他的话，你后面可以直接转五动，也就是说你生完亏一圈都是值得的，只是一个赚多赚少的问题。肯定是一个A级别的卡。但是收益的真实收益的话，那平均就是说真实收益应该是在2~4度。

effect: Each time after you use the "Cattle Market" accumulation space, you can pay 2 food to plow 1 field.
At the end of each work phase, if you occupy both the "Grain Seeds" and "Vegetable Seeds" action spaces, you can plow 1 field.
You can use any "Wish for Children" action space, even if it is occupied by another player's person.
Immediately place any amount of food from your supply on this card. Once per round, you can discard 1 food from this card to place a person from your supply in that round.
chenDesc: 你抓他之后，就是你打客房就跟你家庭版拿一个首生这两件事收益是差不多的。但是家庭版的首生你不一定能拿到客房打出来一个是稳定性要好，你也不怕牺牲也不怕什么，稳定性要好。然后稳定拿到首生的话，基本上他的总体算是一个两动收益。所以他在B级里算是一张比较强的卡。你用它去获得一个娃，是要比你用一些不卡生的生卡去获得一个娃要来得更加方便的。

effect: At the end of each work phase, you can sow exactly 1 crop on 1 field.
chenDesc: 一般来讲是赚两动，就是没有特殊配合的情况下。但是但是他这个四直接打出条件，前期想要完成，就是在第一个收完前想要完成同样还是有难度。但是完成的情况下给两动。总体来讲就是因为他要求比较高，所以就放在C级。那如果这个这个要求低一点的话呢，它是可以有B级的。正常情况下他打出来的时间是在第九回合左右，你可以挡住他，挡下了他之后，他就可以给你一个两边的收益。但是问题在于第九回合不一定想要去打一张发展卡。除非你有什么速度增加之类的东西，这张卡的梯度可以适当上移。

effect: Each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action on an action space, you can build a major improvement instead of playing a minor one.
When you play this card, immediately play the field phase of the harvest on your farmyard only.
At the end of the work phases in rounds 7 and 9, you can take a "Sow" action without placing a person.
At the end of each work phase, you can place 1 food on this card, irretrievably. At any time, you can discard 6 food from this card to build a major improvement at no cost.
chenDesc: 这个东西就是六口饭换田。算是一张很好的核心卡了。他就是你只要前期饭多，你前期饭多你就可以相当于是一张四星卡。四星卡条件前期不缺饭，然后在大部分情况下都是可以拿的。甚至你围绕他去多拿点饭卡都可以。同时它在这个后期他还可以，就是你如果前期缺田的情况下，那你中期总不吃饭了吧。那你就用它去拿一些别人没人要的主发，从而你用这个东西去做出来一些奇怪的东西。比如比如最简单，它是可以配合那张柴火的，就是你在后期去打一些别人不要的烤炉。他主要是起到这个作品，就是有配合，而且单卡只要有饭他就能抓你。前期如果有一张爱宠或者什么之类的卡位，就直接毫不犹豫的可以把他抓下来。

effect: Add 3 to the current round and mark the corresponding round space. At the start of that round, you can play 1 occupation without paying an occupation cost.
chenDesc: 标准一动卡。在一动卡里算是稍强一点的位置，但是没有强太多。延迟三回合的限制并不小。

effect: (This card has no additional effect.)
During the feeding phase of each harvest, your newborns require 2 food (instead of 1).
chenDesc:
效果：两个卡
强度：其实所以一般都是在两个卡里比较差的。因为它的就是一次，那当然他给的是这个高贵的上下文。他几个优势，而且他一定要求打的时间比较早。另外一个是他底下的副作用是客观存在的。从平均来讲的话，他们也是要付出1.5万的代价，那排队收益不是很高了。如果你觉得这张卡，你其实可以参考一张丘陵宅院，觉得他和丘陵宅院的性质差不太多，就是成本差不太多，收益也差不太多。但是比丘尼怎样的适应性要好一点。毕竟就是也是一张你在收打的时候，你不想打卡的时候去打他的一张卡。

effect: Each time you build or play an improvement after this one, you can place 1 reed on this card, irretrievably, to get 1 bonus point, up to the number of rooms in your house.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each of the 5 columns of your farmyard board containing at least one room.
chenDesc:
效果：后期上限卡
强度：它和这个半路其实算是完全一样的性价比。就是它的净赚多少，你拿他打他，如果拿四出的话，那他其实净赚也就两分。两个十多个亿，芦苇本身值一分，同时你本身那样一个造型，造型上也要扣0.5分，就是俩石头一芦苇在里边就是值1.5分，一个造型上亏了1.5分。正厅这张卡通常认为就是净赚两分的一张卡，没有很强。但是它的好处是在于，就是如果你房子扩的比较高的话，你在后期实际上是有非常多的行动想要去拿一些上限。它是一张高贵的后期一张显卡。在这个情况下的话，他是要比这家室内装潢要强的。但是他同样还是那还是那件事，就是它是一张就是虽然他很值得抓，也就是说抓位还是比较高的。但是他的问题在于他的抓位虽然高，但他并不强。他你可以理解为他和客房一样，只是一个稳定性的手段，而不是强度。

effect: From now on, one of your pastures with stable cannot hold animals. Each time you get reed from an action space, you get 1 bonus point.
During scoring, if your farm has no unused spaces, you get 2 bonus points.
During scoring, if you have exactly 4/3/2 people, you get 2/3/5 bonus points.
From now on, at least one of your pastures must contain no animals.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. During scoring, if you have no cattle, you get 3 bonus points.
chenDesc:
效果：一分白板
强度：卡比一分白板多头牛，所以比一分白板强。摆在摆在这个位置吧，比比一分白板多头牛，只要不养牛的卡组都可以抓。

effect: Each time you use "Fishing", you can place up to 2 wood on this card, irretrievably. During scoring, each such wood is worth 1 bonus point, except the 1st, 4th, 7th, and 10th.
Each harvest, you can exchange exactly 1 clay for your choice of 2 food or 1 bonus point.
chenDesc:
效果：上限卡
强度：这张卡的上限感觉还是蛮高的。这张卡的前提就是你要有猪，这个猪从哪里来比较关键。但是你哪怕第四期弄一头猪的话，他都可以用四个资源去换三份。你在就是四个资源换三分，关键是砖这个资源比较便宜。就是他和正厅这两张卡，可能级别是收益是相差不多的，就是都是资源成本和收益都差不多。正经很多时候也就四环完事了，因为他俩就是都是和和这个摆烂的三分画笔，都是一个水平。暂时画笔要比正经打的时间要早一点，就算是画笔一个缺陷。所以画笔的差不多是排在这个位置，算是一张不错的这个上限卡。

effect: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 vegetable, 1 stone, 1 grain, 1 stone, 1 grain on this card. Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you get the top good.
Alternate placing 1 food and 1 clay on each remaining even-numbered round space, starting with food. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
Place 1 cattle, 1 grain, and 1 cattle on the next 3 round spaces (in that order). At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
chenDesc:
效果：拿田
强度：拿到田这件事情其实是有点高之。你能看到水沟就可能会去抽你的技能，仅仅说这样的话，这张卡如果能打出来的话，收益是挺高的。但是因为风险太高，这张卡不出来，所以这张卡总体就是只能排在这个位置。因为这张卡太容易被穿了，然后打的话扣三个时机也比较固定。你前期早期打不开局，那这张卡的时期基本上已经锁死在11回合了。因为如果11回合去一共抢一个骑士，你就会很难受。

effect: If you have 1/2/3/4 stables, place 1 food on each of the next 2/3/4/5 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each remaining odd-numbered round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each remaining even-numbered round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you get at least 1 wood from an action space, place 1 food on the next round space. At the start of that round, you get the food.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, if you live in a clay or stone house, you get 1 or 2 food, respectively.
Each time after any player (including you) builds at least 1 wood room, you get 1 food.
Each time you sow, you get 1 food for every different type of good that you sow.
chenDesc:
效果：提供蔬菜
强度：就是这就是一张没没卡打的时候可以打一下卡，一卡打对，就这个水平没啥没啥卡可抓，你抓一张也算绝对不亏。给刘胜一五就一点点赞，没啥能拿野菜。想要当核心的话，那他唯一的配合基本上就是养蜂巢了。除了他之外，这个野菜基本上就是不痛不痒的三四口饭，乐岛非要用野菜来吃的情况下，也就不好打。

effect: Each time you use "Fishing", place 1 food from the general supply on this card. Each time before you play an occupation, you get food equal to the amount on this card.
For each room that you add to your house, place 1 food from the general supply on this card. At the start of each feeding phase, you get food equal to the amount on this card.
chenDesc:
效果：后期食物核心卡
强度：它也是一张就是批判用的核心卡。它和去哪这三张卡我觉得比较像的，福小房间和东方火炉的。一个是要卖田来吃来给饭，一个是要你只要拿一个火炉来给饭。这个稍微贵一点，这就是这三张卡应该都是同一级别的，算是一张后期的食物核心卡。我觉得他的小房间的话一般就是要冲着装裤子，就是如果用小房间打折扣的房子，他可以说是无损给饭的，还是非常强大的。而且给的还挺多的，能给到十几口的话就很厉害。

effect: Each time you get at least 1 wild boar outside of the breeding phase of a harvest, you can immediately turn them into 4 food each.
Each time you play or build an improvement after this, you can pay 1 additional building resource of a type in the printed cost to get 3 food.
chenDesc:
效果：发展卡相关
强度：就是走私货这张卡发动几次战的。就是你早期外发动第一次差不多是不赚不亏，你发打出来，发动第二次之后才开始赚。那他就是按强度就取决于你能够多快的能够打出发展卡。如果你打这个走私货之后连着这个连打一堆发展的走势都挺强大的。但是在大部分无法做到这一点的卡组里，这个走私货效果是，就他不太是一张能够连发的卡。就是正常情况下，你很难连续打这么多张发量卡。走私货总体没有裸照强度，大概是放在这个位置。

effect: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, if there are 0/1/2/3 food on the space, you get an additional 4/3/2/1 food from the general supply.
Place 4 food from the general supply on this card. At the start of each work phase, if you are the last player in turn order, move 1 food from this card to your supply.
Each time you bake at least 1 grain into bread, you get 1 additional food if you have at least 1 sheep and (another) 1 additional food if you have at least 1 cattle.
At the start of each harvest, you can choose to skip the field and breeding phase of that harvest and get exactly 1 food instead.
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you get 1 additional food for each sheep on the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, up to a maximum of 4 additional food.
When you play this card, you get 1 food. Each time you pay an occupation cost, you can pay 1 building resource of your choice in place of (up to) 2 food.
At the start of each harvest, you get 4 food.
Once per round, if all players have at least 1 person left to place, you can skip placing a person and take a "Bake Bread" action instead.
"Bake Bread" action: At most 1 time Grain → 6 Food When you play this card, you can immediately take a "Bake Bread" action.
"Bake Bread" action: At most 1 time Grain → 3 Food When you play this card, you can immediately take a "Bake Bread" action.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain for every 2 completed rounds.
Each time another player (or, in a solo game, you) uses the "Forest" accumulation space, you get 1 grain.
Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, you get 1 additional grain for each baking improvement you have.
This card is a field on which you can only sow and harvest wood as you would grain. Each time you harvest the last wood from this card, you also get 1 vegetable.
This card is a field that can only grow vegetables. Each time you harvest the last vegetable from this card, you can plow 1 field.
This card is a field. Each time you remove the last grain or vegetable from this card, you can immediately sow vegetable or grain on this card, respectively.
Each time you sow in a field that is orthogonally adjacent to a pasture, you can place 1 additional good of the planted type in it.
This card is a field. During the field phase of each harvest, if you harvest at least 1 good from this card, you also get 1 food.
During the field phase of each harvest, you can select exactly one of your fields and harvest all the crops planted in it.
chenDesc:
效果：播种收获
强度：这卡太开想象力了吧，就是能打打出来的配合还是太少。很少有他在这个六六之间。

effect: When you play this card, immediately place (up to) 5 fences from your supply on it. When you build fences, fences taken from this card cost you nothing.
Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can return 1 stone to the general supply to get an additional 3 wood.
chenDesc:
效果：石头资源
强度：这张卡经常的对比对象是路推，但是这张卡应该他的上限和下限都是要远强于路推的。从上线而言的话，石斧你是可以解锁很多石头卡的装备的，你是比如企业家之类的卡，如果你配合上石斧，他会非常强大。你可以抓非常非常多的石头卡，然后来用来配合石斧，他是增大你的灵活性，而不是减少你的灵活性。第二点是，它的收益是在于前期，RSF是一个非常非常非常强大的行动格，这个行动格的价值是不是2R和三木能比的，这个行动格的竞价值太高了。他唯一的问题就是在于石头不见得能用出去。在这个前提下，石斧提供了一个本sf的石头运出去的解密方案，所以石斧是一张非常非常强大的卡。你从下线的角度的话，他打出的条件要远比例最简单。上线的角度他有更多的配合，而且灵活性也是更高的。总体来讲，石斧是一个非常强大的A级卡。然后他哪怕在后期打出来，他有时候都足够强大了。就是在后期打出来的话，石斧的净收益都可以达到6米这个水平。

effect: When you play this card, you can immediately return up to 3 stables from your farmyard board to your supply and get 3 wood for each.
Each time you get reed and/or stone from an action space, you get 1 additional clay.
When you play this card, you can immediately exchange up to 4 building resources for an equal number of other building resources.
chenDesc:
效果：四换四
强度：收益不算高，作用就是作用。其实小花招是没有别的作用小，但唯一作用就是换芦苇。如果小花招不是用来换芦苇的话，那小花招肯定是用亏了。然后你在换芦苇的情况下，他是不赚，但是能够稳定一下你的节奏的卡。有生的情况下想发招的效果非常苦。或许能有一张其他的声卡把声卡打CB，总体差不多是这个水平。

effect: Each time after you sow in at least 1 field, you get 1 stone.
You can only plant stone on this card. Plant as though it were 3 fields, but it is considered 1 field. Sow and harvest stone on this card as you would vegetables.
This card is an action space for all. A player who uses it gets 1 building resource of each type they already have. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can exchange 1 building resource for another building resource.
At the start of the breeding phase of each harvest, if you have at least 1 unfenced stable without an animal, you get 1 sheep.
You only require 1 sheep to breed sheep during the breeding phase of a harvest. This card can hold 1 sheep.
For each wild boar or cattle that you turn into food, you can place 1 of that food on this card. While its food equals your number of rooms, this card provides room for 1 person.
At any time, you can place wood from your supply on this card, irretrievably. You can keep twice as many animals of any type on this card as there is wood on it.
At the end of the work phases of rounds 7 and 9, you can take a "Renovation" action without placing a person and pay 1 building resource of your choice less.
Once you live in a stone house, at the start of each round, you can pay 2 or 3 wood to build up to 3 or 4 fences, respectively.
After you play your 2nd, 3rd, 5th, and 7th occupation (including this one), you can build 1 stable at no cost.
Each time you get 2 or more newborn animals, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
You can build the Joinery when taking a "Minor Improvement" action. If you use the Joinery (or an upgrade thereof) during the harvest, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
Once this game, if you live in a house with exactly 2 rooms surrounded by 4 field tiles, you can use any "Family Growth" action space even without room.
On your first turn each round, if you have no unused farmyard spaces, you can place a person from your supply.
When you play this card, immediately take a "Renovation" action. Afterward, you can take a "Build Fences" action. (Both actions require their usual cost.)
You can immediately build a baking improvement by paying its cost. Each time another player uses the "Grain Seeds" action space, you can take a “Bake Bread” action.
You can play this card at the start of the work phase of round 1 without placing a person. (This card has no effect other than counting as a played occupation.)
If this is your 3rd occupation, you can immediately play another occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food and/or play 1 minor improvement by paying its cost.
If this is your 1st occupation, you immediately get 1 bonus point for each improvement you have. (This will not apply to improvements played after this card.)
At the end of each harvest, if you live in a stone house, you get 1 bonus point.
At the start of each work phase, if you have at least 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, 1 stone, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable in your supply, you get 1 bonus point.
When you play this card, you get 1 bonus point for each complete stage left to play. You may not play any more occupations.
At the start of each round, you may pay food equal to the number of people you have to buy 1 good of your choice from the general supply.
Pile (from bottom to top) 1 clay, 1 wood, and 1 grain on this card. Each time you get a good matching the top item, you can move that item to your supply and get 1 wild boar.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, place 3 vegetables on the space for round 11. At the start of that round, you get the vegetables.
When you play this card and each time before you use the most recent action space card, you get 1 building resource of your choice and 1 food.
When you play this card, you can immediately turn as many building resources into food as you have people: 1 Wood / 1 Clay → 2 Food 1 Reed / 1 Stone → 3 Food
In the field phase of each harvest, if you have at least 2/4/6/7 fields, you get 1/2/3/4 food.
Each time you build fences, place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to the number of fences just built. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1 reed for 2 food. You can build the Basketmaker's Workshop for 1 reed and 1 stone even when taking a "Minor Impr." action.
At the start of each harvest, you can place 1 wood from your supply on this card, irretrievably. In each feeding phase, you get 1 food for each wood on this card.
As long as you have no minor improvements in front of you, you get 1 food at the start of each round and 1 wood at the start of each harvest.
Each time you would harvest a grain field, you can leave the grain on the field and take 1 grain from the general supply instead.
Each time you take a "Family Growth" action, you also get 1 vegetable.
When you build your 1st and 2nd stable, you get 1 grain. When you build your 3rd and 4th stable, you get 1 vegetable. (This does not apply to stables you have already built.)
Each time after you use the "Grain Seeds" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you can take a "Bake bread" or "Sow" action, respectively.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. Each time after you use an animal accumulation space with your 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th person, you get 1/1/2/2/3 wood.
At the start of each harvest, if you have at least 1 grain field, you get 2 wood.
Each time you get food from an action space, you get 1 additional wood.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, place 4 wood and 4 clay on the space for round 9. At the start of this round, you get the resources.
Alternate placing 1 wood and 1 clay on each of the next 6 round spaces, starting with wood. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective resource.
Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you also get 2 or 3 clay, respectively.
Each time you play or build an improvement, you get your choice of 1 wood or 1 clay immediately after paying its cost.
Pile resources as depicted on this card. (stone, clay, stone, reed, wood, clay) You can use the top item(s) when building a room, playing/building an improvement, or renovating.
You immediately get 2 wood and 2 stone. During scoring, you get 1 negative point for each wood and each stone in your supply. You can no longer discard wood or stone.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 building resource of your choice and, once all people have been placed this round, you can place a person from your supply.
Once you live in a stone house, at the start of each round, you get your choice of 2 wood, 2 clay, 1 reed, or 1 stone.
enDesc: In a big game, Tax collector might bring in 5 or 6 free resources, plus whatever you buy. Slightly awkward in that it gives you resources when others build improvements, but those resources are often most useful for buying the Majors yourself. Still, very high upside. Should be banned in FotM.

effect: When you play this card, if you would score the maximum 4 points in 3 scoring categories (including fenced stables), you can extend your house by 1 room at no cost.
Each time after you build a major improvement, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
If you have a person on the "Day Laborer" action space, you can use non-accumulating round 1-9 action spaces even if they are occupied.
Each time you use a "Wish for Children" action space, you can play 1 additional improvement by paying its cost less 1 resource of your choice.
Immediately after each time you place your last person in a round on the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can play 1 occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.
Harvest: At most 1 time 1 Grain+1 Vegetable → 6 Food Scoring: 1 Grain+1 Vegetable/2 Grain+2 Vegetable/3 Grain+3 Vegetable → 2/4/6 bonus points
Each time you place 2 or 3+ newborn animals on your farm during the breeding phase of the harvest, you get 1 or 2 bonus points, respectively.
Each harvest, you can place 1 harvested crop or 1 newborn animal on this card, irretrievably. Once this game, exchange 2/3/4/5 different goods on this for 3/5/7/9 bonus points.
If there are still 1/3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 1/2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most total vegetables gets 3 bonus points.
If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood and a "Build Fences" action. During scoring, each player with the most pastures gets 2 bonus points.
Each time you use the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain. Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, you also get 1 reed.
If you play this card in round 11 or before, choose an animal type: you immediately get a number of animals of that type equal to the number you already have on your farm.
Select a future round space, subtract the number of the current round from it, and place this many food on that space. At the start of that round, you get the food.
Next round, each time you use a building resource accumulation space, you also get 1 food for each building resource that you take from the space.
Each time you use the "Major Improvement" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you also get 1 vegetable or a "Major or Minor Improvement" action, respectively.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can exchange up to 2 goods as follows: 1 Wood → 1 Grain or 1 Grain → 1 Stone
From round 3 on, at the end of each work phase in which all clay accumulation spaces are unoccupied, you get 1 stone and 1 food.
Each time any player (including you) plays or builds a card that lets them turn building resources into food, you get exactly 1 corresponding building resource and 1 reed.
If you play this card in round 7 or before, choose clay or reed: you immediately get a number of that building resource equal to the number you already have in your supply.
Once this game, immediately after playing or building an improvement, you can choose to get its printed cost from the general supply.
At the start of each harvest, if you have 1/2/3+ fenced stables, you get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle.
Place (up to) 1 stable each on "Grain Seeds", "Farmland", "Day Laborer", and "Farm Expansion". Build the stable at no cost when another player uses that action space.
At the start of the last harvest, you can take up to 2 of each other player's unbuilt fences and build them on your farm at no cost. (Your farm can then have over 15 fences.)
You can use an action space providing both stone and a different building resource even if it is occupied by another player. Stone rooms cost you 2 stone less each.
Once this game, if you have all types of animals, use any "Family Growth" action space even without room.
At the start of each round, you can place 1 food from your supply on the "Traveling Players" accumulation space to play a minor improvement by paying its cost.
Each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 stone for 1 bonus point and 1 food.
Once you live in a stone house, you get 2 food each time any player renovates and, during scoring, 1 bonus point for each wood house and clay house.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, you get 1 stone, 1 vegetable, and 2 wild boar. You cannot grow your family until round 11, unless all other players already have.
Each time another player plays or builds an improvement with a printed clay cost, you get 1 food and 1 clay.
When you play this card as your first occupation, you immediately get 1 food for every other occupation in play (by any player), up to a maximum of 7 food.
At the end of each work phase, you get 1 food for each stone accumulation space with stone on it.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, each of your people requires 1 less food. During scoring, your people are worth 2 points each instead of 3.
Each time another player uses the "Fishing" accumulation space, they get 1 additional food and you get 1 vegetable.
This card is an action space for you only. When you use it, you get 3 grain. You can build the "Stone Oven" major improvement even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action.
At the start of each round, you can move 1 food to this card or discard 1 food from it. If you do either, you get 1 building resource of a type you currently do not have.
Each time after you play an occupation after this one, you get 1 building resource of your choice.
Each time you plow at least 1 field tile, you get 1 sheep for each field tile that you just plowed.
When you play this card and each time you build a major improvement, you get 1 wild boar.
Each time you use the "Traveling Players" or "Fishing" accumulation spaces, you can move exactly 1 food from that space to the other to get 1 cattle.
When you play this card, each player (including you) can choose to get 2 sheep or 2 food; you also get 1 cattle.
At the start of each round, you get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for each unoccupied wood/clay/stone room in your house.
